data.text: @SenatorHagerty @Verizon Not his private records, public employee ... paid for with CITIZEN TAXES, the files belong to the people!
@SenatorHagerty @HarmeetKDhillon @Verizon What??? A strongly worded letter ignored. Say it isn’t so.
@SenatorHagerty @Verizon Sounds like revenge gurl, maybe if you did nothing wrong then you wouldn't really care? Hmmm Bill

@SenatorHagerty @Verizon There’s no evidence @Verizon engaged in an “illegal conspiracy” to spy on lawmakers. Telecoms can be legally compelled to provide records through court orders or subpoenas. Without proof of unlawful conduct, claims of “spying” are rhetoric, not an established fact. #FactsMatter

@LovinTheTruth5 Thank you for contacting our customer service. In response to your query, can you provide more details about your request? Kindly share your complaint, full names, email address, and phone number.
@LovinTheTruth5 We are here to help you and can assist you in accessing your final bill. Please send us a DM so we can provide support
@QuantumMagick @SenatorHagerty @Verizon All the large corporations are horrid!

@RadioP1 @SenatorHagerty @Verizon @TMobile Probably the worst customer service ever with TMobile, & that's saying a lot.

Corporations are no longer being run by hard working Americans, it's all hand-picked cabal running the corporate world.

@SenatorHagerty @Verizon Pretty much all large corporations are completely screwing over the public.  If they even bother to hire support it's DEI or off-shore from a 3rd world country.

T-Mobile & Home Depot, AT&T are a nightmare to work with. They have poorly trained reps, who give incorrect info & if
